intro: Galium parisiense var. anglicum, commonly known as English bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are typically covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and damp meadows.
